properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 9:34PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
A cold front traveling south across Washington and Oregon will
continue to bring snow to the Blue Mountains tonight. Snow will
gradually taper off from north to south, ending late tonight into
early Sunday. Accumulations of 3 to 5 inches will be possible in
the Blue Mountains mainly above 3500 feet. Snowfall rates of one
half to one inch per hour will cause snow to accumulate fast on
the roadways and significantly reduce visibilities, and snow has
already accumulated on portions of interstate 84 in these areas.
This will generate slick and hazardous travel in spots through
Sunday morning as freezing temperatures continue to spill into the
region behind the front.

NWSheadline: MODERATE SNOW TO CONTINUE TONIGHT IN THE BLUE MOUNTAINS
